Ghulam Nabi Khawja, 46, was killed outside his house in Kargund village of Handwara in frontier Kupwara district, about 71 km northwest of Srinagar city, the summer capital of Indian-controlled Kashmir.

source: UNI (United News of India); The Pioneer (India)
notes: Lakhmu Telam, an assistant constable of the Bijapur District Anti-Naxal Operations Cell on a 15 day leave, was fatally attacked with sharp weapons by 4 or 5 Maoists in Nimed village market. The naxals fled before more police arrived.

A 27-year-old RSS worker was hacked to death in a suspected retaliatory attack by the CPI(M), two days after a CPI(M) leader was killed at a nearby shop by members of RSS. Unidentified persons, allegedly belonging to the CPI(M) attacked the victim with lethal weapons on th neck and head near a petrol pump at Pinarayi town, Kerala. The police later arrested four men who said they killed him because they were angry that he was raising to power in the community.

assoc_actor_2: JKPC: Jammu and Kashmir People's Conference
notes: On October 12th, a Jammu and Kashmir People's Conference activist was shot dead by unidentified militants outside his home in Kralgund, Kupwara district.
Two men and a boy were wounded when a bomb exploded after gunmen opened fire on a house.

Communist Party of India (Marxist)'s branch secretary Kuzhichal Mohanan was hacked to death on Monday by six unidentified masked men in Pathiriyad, Kannur district. Another party worker was also injured in the attack. The CPI(M) has claimed the men were RSS workers, and police later arrested several.

source: The Times of India (Electronic Edition); Hindustan Times
notes: Two Dalits were set on fire late on Monday night in poll related rivalry in Chauri Chaura area of Gorakhpur district. Both victims later succumbed to there severe burns.
Sukhchain Singh, a 21-year-old Dalit from Gharanghna village of Mansa district, was killed and his body dismembered by a group of person belonging to the ruling SAD.

50 youths from the Maratha Community attacked Sanjegaon village in Igatpuri and assaulted the villagers, one of which was admitted to city-based JJ hospital in critical condition, and another was sent to Nashik hospital in stable condition. The attackers also vandalised the idols of Gautam Buddha and Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar.
An assistant village chief was slain as he was returning home on a motorcycle. The gunmen were also traveling via motorcycle.

An upper caste schoolteacher killed a Dalit villager with a sharp-edged weapon in Bheta village of Bageshwar district on Oct 6 for touching the flour meant to be consumed by the upper caste persons at a flour-mill.
A former village chief was shot dead. Police were investigating whether the attack was related to the insurgency.
A person was killed and another injured when crude bombs were hurled at them by unidentified assailants in Bhoi sahi village under Govindapur police limits on Tuesday.

A group of cow vigilantes consisting out of Bajrang Dal and Shiv Sena workers attacked a group of Banjara tribals at Relmagra in Rajsamand district of Rajasthan late on Monday night when they were returning to their village with half-a-dozen bulls purchased in a cattle fair. Three of the tribals were seriously injured in the attack.
On October 3rd, unidentified militants used civilian hostages to steal 5 rifles and ammunition from a minority police picket in Samnoo village, Kulgam district. No injuries were reported.

assoc_actor_2: Government of India (2014-); JKNC: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference
notes: Unidentified gunmen Sunday killed a rural body head (locally called Sarpanch) in Indian-controlled Kashmir, police said. The rural body head Fayaz Ahmad Bhat (34) was a grass-root level political worker affiliated with pro-India National Conference, which is currently an opposition in the region. Bhat was fired upon by unknown gunmen inside his house at village Kandizal near Pampore town in Pulwama district, about 20 km south of Srinagar city, the summer capital of Indian-controlled Kashmir.
Three villagers from the Amabeda area, Kanker district were kidnapped and later killed after 20-25 Maoists barged into their homes. They were accused of being police informers.
Maoists in Hurrapijodi village killed three men with knives, accusing them of being police informers.

A group of students assaulted and stabbed the chief administrative officermedical superintendent (MS) of Sir Sunderlal Hospital of Banaras Hindu University (BHU) in Varanasi and damaged his office on Saturday.
Many people were injured after security forces lobbed tear gas shells and fired pellets on a congregation in Nadihal village in Barmulla.
Security forces thrashed scores of people who were travelling through Noor Bagh to Cement Kadal road in Srinagar by allegedly beating up anyone who passed by.
A shooting took place in Bang Kro, Khok Pho, Pattani. The incident is thought to be related to insurgent activities. At least one handgun was used. There were 7 injuries and 1 fatalities.
A man was shot dead while walking home from the local mosque.

actor1: PLFI: People's Liberation Front of India
notes: On Monday, at least three villagers were shot dead and four others were injured when suspected PLFI opened indiscriminate firing on a village level meeting. The incident took place under Arki police station area ofJharkhand's Khunti district.
A group of youth attacked a Congress rally in Ahjnala on Sunday with sickles, baseball bats and other weapons. Three Congress workers were injured in the attack.
An Aam Admi Party (AAP) volunteer was shot dead by an Akali leader over a property dispute at Bhinder Kalan village in Moga district on Sept 25.

An auto rickshaw driver was chased and beaten with iron pipes by gau rakshaks, on Saturday, at Vithalpur chokdi in Sanand taluka for not paying hafta. The victim sustained severe injuries on his right leg and was submitted to the hospital.
A ruling Trinamool Congress activist was murdered by some motor cycle borne assailants near his home in South 24 Parganas district.
A Hindu Munnani spokesperson was hacked to death by a four-member gang at Subramaniyampalayam, Coimbatore, on Thursday night.
A Hindu Munnani leader in Dindigul was admitted to hospital after an unidentified gang attacked him with lethal weapons on Monday night.

Security forces allegedly ransacked scores of residential houses and smashed parked vehicles in Kremshore village in Budgam district and fired pellets at protesters injuring several people. Four youths were also arrested during raids.
A man shot dead his rival over a field boundary-related issue at Akupur village under Asothar police station area in Fatehpur district on Saturday evening.

Maoists on Saturday night killed a 40-year old village doctor in Lohardaga district's Hatwal village. He allegedly did not supply children to their squad and on charges of acting as a spy for rival outfit Jharkhand Jan Mukti Party.
A shooting took place in Tha Muang, Thepa, Songkhla. The incident is thought to be related to insurgent activities. At least one infantry firearm was used. There were 0 injuries and 1 fatalities.

A cow vigilante group beat up three persons, including a minor, while they were trying to dispose of animal entrails and carcasses in Kanjhawala in outer Delhi on Wednesday. The injured victims were submitted to the hospital.
One person was killed as a result of police firing in Kulgam district - police have not confirmed this.
A young man identified as Shahid Ahmad was allegedly killed when security forces opened fire on a group of people in Largam in Shopian district. Police deny that he died as a result of their firing.
A 29-year old Muslim man succumbed to his injuries after he was beaten up by cow vigilantes on Tuesday, a day before Eid ul Zuha.
An Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) volunteer was attacked and seriously injured by Akali members equipped with arms and other weapons at Baghapurana village in Moga district.

assoc_actor_2: Former Police Forces of Thailand (2014-) Border Patrol Police
notes: A former border patrol police officer was killed in a gun attack by an unidentified assailant.
A man was killed and his wife seriously injured in a gun attack. Police were investigating to determine whether the attack was related to the insurgency.

source: Early Times; The Northlines; Hindustan Times
notes: A 20 year old youth was killed after security forces fired pellets and tear gas to disperse protesters in the Batengo village in Anantnag district. Protesters threw stones at police forces and attacked police.
A land dispute took an ugly turn when a group of armed persons attacked another group in a village close to Tarsikka on Sept 8 leading to a bullet injury to one youth.

Inhabitants of Ajar village in Bandipora allege that security forces barged into their homes and beat up civilians without any provocation and damaged property. Two people were severely injured in the raids.

assoc_actor_2: JKNC: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference
notes: On 8 Sept, militants attacked the home of the former National Conference leader Abdul Rashid Khanday in the Damhal Hanjipora area of Kulgam district (J&K). They decamped with four rifles from guards.

A youth was allegedly lynched to death by Maoists on the suspicion of being a police informer. A police team from Awapalli found the body lying near the Dharavaram CRPF camp on the Bijapur-Awapalli road in Bijapur District, which bore multiple injury marks of sharp-edged weapon.
A student leader at DAV College, Sector 10, hailing from Manipur, was thrashed by some unknown youths near his house in Khuda Lahora locality of Chandigarh in the night of Sept 6.

A former deputy sarpanch of Khairat Kala village was shot and killed by 3 suspected Naxals in his home. The group left pamphlets at the scene in which they claimed the man was acting as a mediator and siphoned money off deals.

actor1: PLFI: People's Liberation Front of India
notes: A man was killed by suspected People's Liberation Front of India (PLFI) operatives in Kudasud village on Tuesday.
A Dalit farm laborer was brutally hacked to death by his upper caste employers in Gharaunti village of Rohtak on Tuesday afternoon.
Locals of Qazigund village in Anantnag allege that security forces beat civilians in the village and vandalized their private property.
At least six people were injured when security forces used tear gas to foil a congregation organized by Tehreek e Hurriyat in the Dana Mazar area of Safa Kadal in Srinagar.
Several photojournalists were thrashed by government forces on Saturday in Batamaloo area of Srinagar while they were on their way to perform their professional duties

actor1: PLFI: People's Liberation Front of India
notes: Suspected PLFI militants killed three persons, suspecting them of seeking entry into their rival Jainath Sahu group, also known as the Samrat group. This happened at Kasira village in Karra, 15km from Khunti district headquarters, 50km from Ranchi.
Security forces fired tear gas canisters into the residence of senior journalist Qayoom Zulfi in Syed Ali Akbar in Srinagar injuring his wife and his daughter.
A man and his family was assaulted by a group of armed 100 persons over a property dispute in Sohana locality in Mohali, late Monday night.

A Dalit family was attacked by a group of upper caste men belonging to the Mali community who tried to forcefully evict them from disputed land on Aug 28. One of the victims sustained multiple fractures and injuries after upper caste men ran a tractor over his legs.
A community leader was shot dead at a tea shop. Police were investigating whether the death was related to the insurgency.

Unidentified men from Saidpur hostel had entered the Patna College campus on Wednesday and shot at Neeraj Kumar, injuring him seriously. Neeraj, a sophomore, is a student leader associated with Madhepura MP Pappu Yadav's Jan Adhikar Party (Loktantrik).

25-year-old Sikh youth was beaten up by activists of radical Sikh organisations and villagers after he was suspected of tearing pages of a holy book and throwing these on the outskirts of Daulatpura Niwan village in Moga district on August 22. The youth sustained injuries on the head and other parts of the body.

source: Indian Express; The Times of India (TOI)
notes: A 63-year-old Muslim man was thrashed by a group of four men allegedly belonging to Gau Rakshaks on Sunday night in Pandesara area of Surat city on suspicion that the victim was carrying cow meat and cow body parts in a transport vehicle. The victim suffered several injuries and had to be hospitalized.

A 60-year-old Dalit woman was shot dead on Saturday morning by her neighbours belonging to the upper caste Thakur community in her village over a land dispute in Kurawali police station area of Mainpuri district.
Police forces raided civilian homes in Baramullah district with many civilians resisting police entry leading to clashes. Around 30 civilians were injured during raids.
Unidentified assailants gunned down Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Vinod Yadav in Nuagachia sub-division of Bhagalpur district in Bihar, 240 km from state capital Patna, early Saturday morning.
An elderly couple was injured during a midnight raid on their residence in Tral's Kamla Bachoo village when police fired on their couple while they tried to resist their son's arrest.

actor1: IPFT: Indigenous People's Front of Tripura
notes: In two separate incidents in areas of the constituency, two CPM workers - Harendra Debbarma and Patiranjan Debbarma - were injured in organised attacks by IPFT workers last night and both had to be shifted to GB Hospital.
Hindu Jagarana Vedike members killed two men, one belonging to BJP, suspecting they were transporting calves to a slaughterhouse. Cops later arrested 18 men.

source: Kashmir News Service; The Northlines; Hindustan Times
notes: A civilian was beaten to death when the army raided houses in Shaar Shaali in Khrew in Pulwama district. 24 other civilians were killed in raids.
A Dalit youth was stabbed to death by men belonging to upper castes in a village of Ambala district on Monday night after he resisted their abuses and humiliation.

A group of unidentified assailants opened fire at Rohtak's Kultana village sarpanch (local leader), his wife and son in the early hours on Monday, leaving them critically injured. The police suspects a political rivalry behind the attack.
A former sub-district chief was shot dead while working on his farm field. Police were investigating whether the death was related to the insurgency or to political conflict.

actor1: ULFA-I: United Liberation Front of Assam-Independent
notes: Two people were killed and seven others injured when militants opened fire at two houses in Parbatipur village in Assam's easternmost Tinsukia district on Friday evening. The attackers were suspected to be part of the United Liberation Front of Asom-Independent (Ulfa -I).

actor1: ULFA-I: United Liberation Front of Assam-Independent
source: UNI (United News of India); The Economic Times
notes: At least one person was killed and two others injured in firing by suspected ULFA(I) militants in Philobari in Tinsukia district this evening.

At least 50 people, suffered injuries after armed forces personnel stormed Arhama-Manigam hamlet in Ganderbal district Friday and used force to 'punish' residents for playing Azadi songs from local mosque.

A group of people killed a cow lifter, Anwar Hussein (45) and critically injured another two at Thakurbilla village (under Lakhipur station, Goalpara, Assam). They also set on fire the van in which the three stolen cows were carried.
Four civilians were injured in a firing incident in the outskirts of Pattan in Baramulla after forces shot at them.

Senior BJP leader Brijpal Teotia, along with five associates, was seriously injured when they were attacked by armed assailants in Ghaziabad on August 11. The police suspects that the motive of the attack is a longstanding property dispute.
Militants opened fire on a group of local civilians engaged in daily labour in Keran resulting in the death of one local civilian while injuring another.
Kulwinder Jhalli, a local BSP leader, was attacked and killed by a group of locals on August 8 in Dhogri village.

actor1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: Residents alleged that a youth who according to them had gone to hospital for checkup was caught hold by police and CRPF personnel and was beaten to pulp. "He was half-dead when we saved him from the clutches of the armed forces and shifted him to SDH Bijbehara," they said.
Two cow traders were beaten up and their vehicle set afire by local cow vigilantes in Sutana village of Panipat district on Sunday night.

Punjab'Aos Rashtriya Swayamsewak Sangh (RSS) vice-president Brig Jagdish Gagneja (retd) was shot by two bike-borne assailants near Jyoti Chowk in Jalandhar on Saturday late evening. He was rushed to hospital with three bullet injuries in the abdomen.
3 pilgrims suffered serious injuries after they were hit by shooting stones in Trikuta hills of Reasi district.
Two gunmen on a motorcycle opened fire at 10 young Muslim men following a religious activity.
An official from the Narcotics Control Board and another person were wounded in a shooting police said was related to the ongoing unrest in the region.
On Thursday night, residents of Dabri and Kalampura villages attacked and injured three powerhouse employees on duty and vandalised the offices of two powerhouses in Dabri village over a power cut.
In an attack at a village under Sapormeina PS in Sadar Hills, suspected Kuki armed militants from KUFO killed a villager while the village chief sustained serious bullet injuries.
A group of armed persons of Dhayanpur Dera village attacked and killed a youth belonging to the lower caste Gujjar community in Rayya (Amritsar) on August 3 over the issue of grazing cattle.

On 26 July, a 30-year old woman in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum, was hacked to death over a land dispute. The assailant and the woman were both from Dara village and the attack took place near the village.
Maoists killed two villagers near Bijapur suspecting them to be informers.
Maoists killed a student in Murja village near Gadchiroli, suspecting him to be an informer.

A 6-year long political rivalry between the local Congress and BJP units led to a shooting in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh court when 2 men (BJP) attacked several accused (Congress) who arrived for hearing in a 2010 murder case. One of the accused was killed in the firing incident.

actor1: ULFA: United Liberation Front of Assam
notes: On August 1, the son of BJP leader Ratneswar Moran, from eastern Assam's Tinsukia district was abducted by the anti-talk faction of the United Liberation Front of Asom (ULFA).
Two Dalit community members were beaten up by 'cow vigilantes' on suspicion of cow slaughter on July 28 in Takrohi area of Indiranagar.
A shooting took place in La-nga, Mayo, Pattani. The incident is thought to be related to insurgent activities. At least one handgun was used. There were 0 injuries and 1 fatalities.
Journalists were attacked by police forces in Srinagar, for reporting on police brutality in the ongoing protests against militant Burhan Wani's killing.

Members of the Peoples' Guerilla Army, a Maoist organization, killed three people, including two sons of a surrendered Maoist, in the forests of Jharkhand near Garhwa. In a pamphlet thrown near the bodies it was claimed that the victims were killed due to their roles as police informers.
On the 22 of July, a shootout occurred at a fruit stand as the vendor ignored a strike call by protestors condemning the killing of hizb militant Burhan Wani.
Following rumours that a Kokernag family was "in knowhow" of the operation which killed militant commander Burhan Wani, angry youth on Thursday set ablaze the house where Burhan was killed.

An 18-year old Zahoor Ahmad's body was found nearby Kisirgam Kakapora village - he had last left home to attend Burhan Wani's funeral - the source notes that residents believe that he was killed by security forces.
A former separatist who switched sides to serve with a ranger unit (but was at the time a civilian rubber tapper) was wounded in a gun attack near his home.
A village chief was shot and wounded in a gun attack. He was sitting in a tea shop when two men arrived on a motorcycle and opened fire before speeding away.

actor1: NSCN-IM: National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Isak-Muivah
notes: Last night, three labourers were physically assaulted by NSCN (IM) cadres.
A 16-year old died at the hand of police forces on Thursday, when they picked him up for questioning from Bundu. He was beaten up leading to his death.
On Wednesday, Maoists gunned down a member of rival JJMP, while the latter was going for his marriage ceremony.

On Tuesday, a wife of slain TMC activist was burnt alive in Jamaitola village of Malda district, allegedly by INC activists. She was killed because she refused to withdraw a 2013 murder case against INC.

A senior member of United Kuki Liberation Front (UKLF), another signatory group of SoO with the Central and state government, was killed by suspected rival group belonging to the Kuki National Organisation (KNO) at Moreh in Chandel District.

On Tuesday, founding president of Hmar National Army (HNA), was shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Chrachandpur. The HNA is a tribal armed group which is a signatory to the ongoing Suspension of Operation (SoO).

A shooting took place in Phraiwan, Tak Bai, Narathiwat. The incident is thought to be related to insurgent activities. At least one firearm of an unknown type was used. There were 3 injuries and 1 fatalities.

Two men were killed in a bomb explosion and a shooting. Police said the bomb was detonated as the victims' motorcycle was passing. After the bomb went off, militants opened fire, killing both men on the spot.
An assault with no weapons took place in Balo, Raman, Yala. The incident is thought to be related to insurgent activities. No weapons were used. There were 0 injuries and 0 fatalities.
A motorcyclist claims he was assaulted by police after he failed to stop his motorcycle as he was approaching a roadside checkpoint.

actor1: PLFI: People's Liberation Front of India
assoc_actor_2: PLFI: People's Liberation Front of India
notes: Six old leaders of PLFI killed by PLFI ultras at Hidingdag village, 15 km from Ranchi

A 40 year-old man, Bechar Dekavadia, was beaten up in Gugaliyana village near Thangadh town of Surendranagar district late on Monday night allegedly over an old land dispute. Dekavadia was rushed to the civil hospital.
A religious leader was shot dead in a ride-by attack while he was traveling via motorcycle to a local mosque.
The president of Congress' block of Baran district was beaten to death by a group of men in Devari village
Naxals allegedly shot dead a deputy sarpanch in Bijapur district in Chhattisgarh
Former Sarpanch of Jasdev Singh Nagar was attacked by six armed assailants near Gill village this morning in his car near Gill Village near Ludhiana. He survived his injuries
A farmer of Jatiwal village (near Machhiwara, Ludhiana, Punjab) was murdered by unidentified persons. He was residing in Jatiwal village and found dead near the village water tank.
A property dealer and brother of a BJP councillor was attacked with sharp-edged weapons by around four persons in Sector 8, here this morning. The victim was severely injured.
Sonu Goyal, a former block Congress chief, leader was beaten to death by unidentified assailants who assaulted him with iron rods and sticks, due to political rivalry in Baran district of Rajasthan.

A farmer died under unclear circumstances at the Bhopalgarh police station of Jodhpur district, Rajasthan. He was in custody after being in an argument with power sector employees. 5 police officers were suspended.

Members of the Diocese of Lucknow allegedly broke into the campus of Sherwood College in Nainital armed with firearms abusing and beating up the college staff on the evening of Friday. The intruders claimed that the present administration has not handed over the campus despite apex court orders. The district administration and police had to intervene to evict the intruders.

Members of the Diocese of Lucknow broke into the campus of Sherwood College in Nainital armed with firearms abusing and beating up the college staff on the evening of Friday. The intruders claimed that the present administration has not handed over the campus despite apex court orders. The district administration and police had to intervene to evict the intruders.

assoc_actor_2: Prepak: Peoples Revolutionary Party of Kanleipak
notes: A top surrendered militant leader and his driver were shot dead by unidentified gunmen on the complex of 7 battalion Manipur Rifles at Khabeisoi village in Imphal East district on Thursday. The deceased, Ningombam Nabachandra (57), was the former chairman of the proscribed People's Revolutionary Party of Kangleipak (PREPAK).

actor1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Indo-Tibetan Border Police Force
notes: Jawans of Indo-Tibetan Border Police Force (ITBPF) had attacked the ABSU's unit office and physically assaulted one of its activists Tuesday night at Birhangaon under Dhaligaon Police Station in Chirang district.
A Thai man launched an attack with guns and explosives, leaving one dead and six others injured. Police say the motive was a land dispute.

A Catholic priest was attacked by unidentified assailants in Udalguri District in Assam's Bodoland Territorial Areas Districts (BTAD). The unprecedented incident took place at a church located near Bhairabkunda in Udalguri District of northern Assam on Sunday night.
An assistant to a village headman was seriously injured in a gun ambush attack. He was riding his motorcycle on patrol in the village when the gunmen opened fire.
A few days ago, several people, residents of Sirsa district, assaulted a Dera follower over a land dispute in Bathinda district.

actor1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
notes: Two cattle lifters, identified as Bangladeshi nationals, were shot dead for intruding into the Indian border in West Bengal's Malda district today.
Alleged case of torture at the police station against two men arrested during the closure of a liquor store
A woman and her son were seriously injured when they were beaten up by their neighbours.

In the latest incident of a series of revenge killings over a longstanding land dispute, a 45-year-old man was bludgeoned to death in South-West Delhi's Chhawla on Thursday by rivalling family members.
An Akali sarpanch fired at a group of people, injuring three of them, over a land dispute at Jaura Singh village (Batala Tehsil, Gurdaspur, Punjab) on June 16.

The former commander of Nonthaburi police was found dead from a gunshot wound inside of his car. The death was being treated as a suicide but there was no evidence to support that theory, and his status as a high-profile member of the police implies potential for a political motive.
Samajwadi Party's district secretary Gaurav Yadav was beaten up by Cantonment police station cops in Gorakhpur on Monday night.

A group of masked men attacked Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) activist Rajwinder Singh Panniwala near Dhani Inakhera on the Panniwala-Malout road in Muktsar with iron rods and batons. Rajwinder suffered minor injuries and was taken to the Primary Health Centre, Alamwala.

source: The Times of India (TOI); North India Press
notes: A follower of Dera Sacha Sauda was shot at on Monday morning at Burj Jawahar Singh Wala village o(Jaitu, Faridkot, Punjab). The victim later succumbed to his injuries.
Two young men of Shivpur Kukrian village, who were taking the Ramayana book on a motorcycle, were beaten up by residents of neighbouring villages.
A Dalit group allegedly attacked former Shiromani Akali Dal (Badal) sarpanch Karminder Singh and his family over a land dispute on Sunday in Macchi Nangal village of Amritsar.
A Dalit group allegedly attacked former Shiromani Akali Dal (Badal) sarpanch Karminder Singh and his family over a land dispute on Sunday in Macchi Nangal village of Amritsar.

Seven people, including a Youth Congress worker, were injured when some villagers, who are asscotiated to Shiromani Akali Dal, fired at them at Bhupal Khurd village in Mansa on Sunday afternoon over a land dispute. The injured have been referred to DMC Hospital at Ludhiana.
Congress worker Rajesh Kumar Neeta Goniana village, was injured in an attack this morning near Goniana village on the Malout road.

An eleven-year-old boy was set ablaze by four youths over a panchayat election rivalry at Naraini Bazar area in Banda district on Saturday night. The victim sustained serious burns and was admitted to a hospital.

On June 10 members of the Gau Raksha caught two alleged cow smugglers with 300 kg beef on their way to Delhi and forced the two men to eat a concoction of cow dung, cow urine, milk, curd and ghee near the Badarpur border.
Panchayat head (Mukhiya) of Harnaut region in Bihar's Nalanda District was shot dead by bike-borne assailants on Friday afternoon at Harnaut market.
Some persons who reportedly went to meet liquor baron and SAD former halqa in charge Shiv Lal Doda in sub-jail at Fazilka yesterday had attacked realtor Neeraj Thatai

Two motorcycle-borne unidentified assailants on Thursday shot at and seriously injured Ara Municipal Corporation Deputy Mayor Basant Singh near his house in Ara, the headquarter town of Bihar's Bhojpur district.

actor1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
notes: A Bangladeshi young man was shot to death by members of Indian Border Security Force (BSF) in Char Majhardiar bordering area of Paba upazila under Rajshahi early Thursday.

An armed squad of suspected Maoists shot dead a man for allegedly stopping two 'self-styled commanders' of the banned outfit from raping his wife in Aurangabad district of Bihar on Thursday. The man was shot seven times at Gewal Bigha village and he died on the spot.
Upper caste Rajput men killed a Dalit man over a land dispute on Thursday in Jasoori village under the Makrana police station of Nagaur district.

A 30 year old youth was shot at by some unidentified assailants at Mohanpur under Titagarh police station in Barrackpore on Thursday night. Local sources however claimed Das is known to be an active Trinamool Congress worker and the attack on him may be a fall out of a rivalry between two TMC factions.
A man was allegedly abducted by four armed Maoists from the road between Mosaboni to Dumuria on June 8.

A J&K policeman was attacked at the Panipat railway station by unidentified assiliants late last night when he was returning to his native village from Delhi. The policeman was critically injured in the attack.
A village headman and his assistant were killed and three other people were wounded by gunmen. The victims were digging a well when the assailants arrived on a pick-up truck and opened fire.

A truck driver suffered injuries when an unknown armed person with sophisticated weapons fired indiscriminately at the vehicle at Changoubung village under Kangpokpi Police Station yesterday at around 9.30 pm. He suspected the person to be from underground outfit.
Armed men shot dead an army jawan visiting his family on holiday at Ranewali village in Amritsar in a two families clash
A village head was shot dead and his wife was wounded in a gun attack. The slain man was a strong contender for the tambon chief's position, and police believed the motive was political.
Bodawal village sarpanch assaulted Dalit leader and Mazdur Mukti Morcha (MMM) state president Bhagwant Smao. He was hospitalized

CPM cadres have been accused of murdering a 35-year-old man at Khowai bus stand in West Tripura on Wednesday for objecting to a driver who was driving a bus from Agartala under the influence of alcohol.

A 48-year-old man was shot in the shoulder by two bike-borne men who chased him for around 100 metres on a crowded road at the Kantinagar market in East Delhi's Krishna Nagar on Tuesday afternoon. The police suspect the incident was a fallout of a property dispute.

A mob of around 150 members of Bajrang Dal and the cow protection vigilante group Gau Raksha Samiti beat up three alleged cow smugglers and stripped one of them naked in Pratapgarh district on Tuesday.
A group of seven men including a transporter shot at a men when working in his fields
A 45-year-old constable was abducted from his home and shot dead allegedly by Maoists in Palam Nawamandi village under Chainpur police station area of Gumla district late on Monday night.
A boy was killed over a land dispute. They boy was found dead at Pakhikalan village in Faridkot district.
A CPM activist was killed by unknown assailants, suspected to be affiliated with BJP, in Engandiyur. The attack follows a spate of clashes between BJP and CPM after election results.
In Hooghly's Bhadreshwar, a BJP supporter from the area, was found murdered. His brother alleged Trinamool supporters were behind the killing.
In South 24-Parganas, a TMC supporter was shot allegedly by CPM supporters on Saturday. He succumbed to his injuries on Sunday.

Unknown assailants attacked a Trupti Desai, a Women's Rights activist who, along with her followers, has been entering Hindu temples to pray following a Supreme Court decision. She was seriously injured.
Ahead of the Bihar polls, unidentified assailants seriously injured a Mukhiya candidate by opening fire on him at Baradih village under Mufassil police station area in Rohtas district last night.
Many people in Canning-sub division were beaten up and tortured in post election violence by a faction of TMC.
Maoists kidnapped and killed a resident in Cholnar village in Dantewadander.
Maoists killed an 18-year-old villager in Heeramandla, Kondagaon district under suspicion that he was a police informer.

In election related violence in Bihar, a LJP leader Sudesh Paswan and his cousin were shot dead by unidentified assailants today while he was campaigning for his wife, a candidate for Mukhiya of Kachar Panchayat. It took place under Dumaria police station. Both died in the attack.
A 28 year old civilian (Liyaqat Joo) body was recovered from the forest area of Wadder Payeen in Handwara. Authorities suspect that he was shot dead by militants in the area.

In Vaishal district, Vijay Rai, brother of a mukhiya candidate from Manjhauli panchayat Ajay Rai, sustained serious injuries when unidentified assailants opened fire on him under Bidupur police station area today.

A sarpanch candidate and a kin of mukhiya aspirant were seriously injured in Darbhanga, when a group of unidentified assailants opened fire on them in violence erupted before ninth phase of Bihar panchayat elections on May 26.
CPI-Maoists killed three men calling them police informers at Gadi village under Chakai police station in Jamui district of Bihar bordering Giridih district in Jharkhand, police said.

In post electoral violence in Nadia district, Bacchu Suraj Rao (24), a supporter of AITC, was killed when 10-12 unidentified assailants, who came on motorcycles, attacked him.The violence occurred at Ambagan under ward no 6 in Bhatpara.

In post election violence, shots were fired at Nanoor, Birbhum when Trinamool workers Burhan Sk and Lal Sk were heading to the market at Kirnahar on Friday. Burhan received bullet wounds and was admitted to Burdwan Medical College.

One person was killed and eight others injured when two bombs exploded at CPI(M)-led LDF's poll victory rallies in Kerala's Kannur district. CPI (M) alleged that some RSS-BJP workers came in a vehicle and hurled a bomb at Pinarayi.

Late on Thursday night, Maoists laid siege to the Jhargram Dhanbad passenger train for an hour at the Kokpara station in East Singhbhum district. They abducted the driver and the guard, and beat them up at the station master's cabin before they decamped with their walkie-talkie sets.

In post electoral violence, a supporter of ruling All India Trinamool Congress, identified as Laxman Pramanik (60), was lynched while he was protesting a victory celebration of the Congress at Bagmundi, Purulia, last night. The victim was stabbed when he asked the people not to use firecrackers which were creating noise.

A Trinamool supporter from Kakinara in North 24-Parhanas, Suraj Rao (30), was lynched by fellow party men on Thursday night. Rao was bursting crackers during a victory procession for Bhatpara Trinamool candidate Arjun Singh when rods and sticks landed on him.
1 civilian was killed (Mohamad Yousuf Lone) after he was fired on by militants in the Gudoora area of Pulwama district.
Unidentified assailants murdered a Congress leader. Police are still searching for a motive.

Dhadhrainwale's cavalcade was attacked by over two dozen persons, who stopped their cars to offer water and then opened fire on his car. Dhadhrainwale escaped the attack but his accomplice Bhupinder Singh was killed. The activists of Sikh fundamentalist seminary Damdami Taksal made the assassination attempt on the Sikh preacher.

In election related violence, the body of CPI(M) activist Nimai Mondal was recovered on Tuesday from near a health centre in Khejuri, a village in Nandigram. The district CPI(M) leadership said Mondal was missing since Monday and was lynched by Trinamool workers. The Trinamool denied the allegation.
A man was shot to death in a gun attack as he was returning home on a motorcycle. Police were investigating to find out if the killing was related to the insurgency.
A senior journalist/Siwan bureau chief of Hindi daily Hindustan was shot dead by unidentified assailants on Friday.
BJP members attacked Dalits in Bhiwandi. One Dalit was killed.

A journalist was shot dead at Dewaria in this district. Akhilesh Pratap Singh (35), who worked for a news channel, was gunned down last night by Maoist splinter group Tritiya-Sammelan Prastuti Committee (TPC).
On Monday, an ITI student was beaten to death at Diamond Harbour in South-24 Parganas district. He was reportedly killed on the suspicion that he was a cattle smuggler.
A rubber tapper was shot dead as he was returning home on a motorcycle.
Under Mahishadal area, BJP worker Kartik Maity was beaten up by TMC cadres while he was returning home on Saturday night. He has been admitted to Mahishadal Hospital with severe injuries.
A CPI(M) worker in Cooch Behar had a narrow escape after a bullet missed him by inches. In Howrah's Liluah, the grandson of a CPI(M) leader was thrashed by local Trinamool supporters.
Two Congress workers were shot at in Malda by alleged Trinamool men. Both were admitted to Malda Medical College and Hospital.

In Murshidabad, a Trinamool Congress district general secretary Bapi Sarkar was shot and critically injured While TMC blamed the Congress for the incident the latter said the incident was a product of intra-party clash.

On May 4, gunshots were fired at a CPM leader's house at Senhati in Behala in Kolkata city (West Bengal). This was the latest in a series of attacks on Opposition workers and leaders since the last phase of elections in Calcutta on May 1.
A Trinamool youth was injured when Congress supporters of Canning West constituency partly chopped off his ear.

Bhagwat Raut, a Bharatiya Janata Party leader, was shot dead by two men who came on a motorcycle near his residence at Mahuadangal colony on Tuesday. Though police are probing all angles, including personal dispute, as reasons behind the murder, Marandi said there was a political conspiracy.

Attacks were staged at Jadavpur constituency where several houses of opposition voters were attacked by Trinamool workers, who smashed window panes, molested women and beat men giving some of them broken limbs.
On Monday, Gofur Molla and members of his family were attacked by Trinamool cadres. They vandalised his house and injured the women members of his family.

In Nabagram of Baruipur East, two TMC supporters were shot at and two more were attacked with sharp weapons. While TMC leaders alleged that CPI(M) men were behind the attack, Left leaders claimed that one faction of the ruling party targeted another.
On Monday, Trinamool had attacked CPI(M) leaders and their houses in the southern fringes of Kolkata.
In election related violence, at Nabagram under Baruipur constituency unidentified assailants fired on a group of people, injuring three of them. TMC alleged that CPIM was behind the attacks.

A group of Trinamul supporters assaulted a nine-year-old girl in the city last night at Haridevpur in Behala (East) because her grandfather had cast his vote despite ruling party cadres warning him not to.

assoc_actor_2: AITYC: All India Trinamool Youth Congress
notes: A Trinamool Yuva worker, Samir Malik, was found dead in Hooghly's Balagarh on Friday morning. His body was found in an agricultural field there. Hooghly district Trinamo ol Yuva president Santanu Banerjee alleged that CPM and Congress workers were behind Malik's murder.
An RJD leader, Anil Kumar, was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Saharsa's Bihra police station area.

On Wednesday night, unidentified assailants fired on two Trinamool Congress workers in Bijpur, North 24- Parganas. One of them sustained bullet injuries while the other was beaten up. Both have been admitted at a hospital in Kalyani.
On Tuesday, at Jagaddal in North 24-Parganas, unidentified assailants attacked the residence of a CPI(M) activist who was threatened not to go to the polling station on Monday. They also beat him up.

A 10-year-old boy from South 24-Parganas' Bhangor constituency became the third child victim of political violence in Bengal when he was tied up and assaulted by alleged Trinamool workers on Tuesday for making a kite out of a party poster.

Two rubber wood traders were killed in a gun attack while traveling by car. The assailants shot at them from a pick up truck. Police were investigating whether the attack was related to the insurgency.
In election related violence, a three-and-a-half year old child was assaulted along with his family members by TMC supporters at Bijpur in North 24 Parganas district for supporting the CPI (M).

Three members of a family were killed over a land-related dispute in Murhu area of Khunti district late last night. A gang of over a dozen men attacked the family at Juri village in Murhu, around 20km from the Khunti district headquarters and 60km from capital Ranchi.
Congress leader Ashok Kaka was shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Haryana's Rohtak district.

Voting-related violence claimed a life in West Bengal Thursday with a CPM supporter killed in Murshidabad's Domkal. He died after crude bombs were hurled, by Trinamool Congress workers, outside booth 173 of Sirpara in Domkal.
In Burdwan's Ketugram, a CPM worker's ear was slashed at Katmur because he dared to vote against the ruling TMC party.
A Congress booth worker Basu Malpaharia was abducted by the TMC workers and was later rescued. A complaint was lodged at the Hariharpara Police Station.
A CPI-M supporter, Sahidul Islam, was killed in Domkal, Murshidabad by bombs and bullets fired by ruling Trinamool Congress supporters.
A CPM worker was murdered by TMC men. The man was missing since Wednesday and his dead body was found on the roadside in Canning, South 24-Parganas, last night.
Tension prevailed in Meerut after a Bharatiya Janta Party (BJP) worker was shot dead by five scooter -borne assailants.

On Tuesday, in Nadia's Haringhata, the home of CPM leader Bankim Ghosh, was vandalised, by Trinamool supporters. The attackers also entered nearby homes and attacked women. Three CPM supporters were injured.
A Youth Congress leader and his lawyer were attacked by a group of Akali workers inside Giddarbaha police station.
Maoists on Monday night killed a college student on suspicion of his being a police informer at Kuimunda village under Boden police limits of Nuapada district.
Suspected Maoists had killed on Monday a person in a hamlet of the Sunabeda-Patdarha plateau in Odisha's Nuapada district. He was accused of being a police informer.
On Monday, at Belgharia's Deshapriya Nagar, a meeting of the forum "Amra Akranto" was attacked by TMC. 15 people were injured.

A person was hacked to death on Sunday night. Later, at Jangipara constituency in Hooghly, BJP and Trinamool clashed over the murder, even as both the parties claimed the victim to be their supporter.
In election related violence, a CPI(M) agent was abducted from a booth in Kankartala of Dubrajpur constituency under Birbhum district.
A group of militants opened fire on a railway security checkpoint, but inflicted no casualties.
A Trinamool Congress (TMC) worker has been shot dead by unidentified gunmen in West Bengal's Hooghly District.
On Thursday, a group of Trinamool supporters fired shots at the election rally of Left Front candidate and sitting MLA from Cooch Behar North constituency.
Five gunmen fired on a train carrying passengers and railway employees. The train was moving when the shots were fired from a hill near the train's tracks in Ban Ata Khuwor village. No one was hurt.
Three photojornalists have been attacked by security guards deployed to the Bombay House for the visit of Tata Sons. Three of the security guards have been arrested by the Police.
In election related violence, a CPI (M) polling agent was hospitalised after being attacked by TMC workers at a polling booth in Chandrakona.

CPM polling agent Zulfan Ali was abducted from booth number 289 of Ghatal. While the CPM alleged that ruling party workers had been behind this, the Trinamool district leadership brushed aside all allegations.

Trinamool Congress worker, Jaydeb Jana was beaten to death at Sabang in West Midnapore district of West Bengal late on Friday night. According to Trinamool Congress leader from Sabang the attack was spearheaded by Congress-Left alliance workers.
Two men sitting in front of a house were shot and wounded by insurgents who rode by on two motorcycles.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Thailand (2014-) Volunteer Defense Corps
notes: A former defense volunteer was found shot dead on the side of the road, and his motorcycle had been stolen. Police said they feared the motorcycle may be used to make a bomb.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Thailand (2014-) Volunteer Defense Corps; Labour Group (Thailand)
notes: An assistant village chief and a defense volunteer were shot dead in a drive-by shooting.
The chairman of a tambon administration organization was wounded in a gun attack. Police were investigating to determine if the attack was related to the insurgency or to personal conflict.

Two customers were killed and one wounded in a shooting attack at a tea shop. The gunmen first threw a grenade into the shop and then, when it did not explode, opened fire before fleeing. Police believe the attack might be the work of an insurgent group which is an ally of the group Runda Kumpulan Kecil.
A tambon administration organization employee was killed in a gun attack while returning home on a motorcycle. The attack was executed by two unidentified militants.
Three men were lynched on charges of stealing cattle in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district. This was the second such incident of violence related to cattle in a week.
A reporter was shot dead at a rubber plantation. Police were investigating whether the killing was related to the insurgency.
Three women were wounded, one seriously, when two motorcycle-riding gunmen opened fire on a noodle shop. Police were investigating the motive.
Two CPI(ML) Liberation activists were shot dead in Masudanpur diara under Balia police station of Begusarai district on Monday night.

Two Muslim cattle traders, one minor, were murdered in Balumath. Five suspects, including a member of a local cow protection vigilante group, were arrested on Saturday for allegedly hanging to death two Muslim cattle herders in a communally-sensitive region of Jharkhand.
